div.sent: When the father of a family dies, the members of the family feel they are in great distress.
They wonder how the family can run without the head.
At this stage a family faces many problems.
The same happens when a Chief of a society dies.
The arises as to who is going to take his place and do his job.
Some confusion may arise.
Similarly, when the Head of a state dies, a nation faces a crisis.
Therefore, an election is held to decide which political party is to assume power.
So we see, in a family, in the society, or in a State, when the leader dies, many problems arise.
At least for a short time all activities in such a family, a society or State slows down.
Our Lord Jesus Christ was the Teacher and Master of his disciples.
When he was crucified, his disciples became confused and some doubts were there.
They were afraid.
Out of fear they took shelter in a room in Jerusalem, with all doors and windows closed.
What will happen when Jesus is not with them?
However, during the forty days after the Resurrection, Jesus appeared to them and gave them courage.
He told the disciples not to leave Jerusalem, but to wait there.
He told them, You will be baptized with the Holy Spirit and be filled with power;
then you will be witnesses for me to the end of the world.
Having made this promise to his disciples, Jesus ascended into heaven.
Who is the Holy Spirit ?
The Christians believe and the Church teaches that the Holy Spirit is the Third Person of the Holy Trinity.
He too is God.
Because he is God, he is invisible Spirit, without any form.
He is eternal and without beginning;
he is the Almighty and All-knowing God;
he is the Comforter and Counsellor;
he is the Spirit of Truth and Love.
These are symbols which express that he is really present.
What Do We Mean by the Holy Trinity ?
The Holy Trinity is mystery.
This means that it cannot be explained by logical or intellectual arguments.
But in faith we accept this as a revealed Truth.
The communion of the Three Persons in One God is known as the Trinity.
The Father is the First Person, the son is the second person and the Holy Spirit is the Third person of the Holy Trinity.
God himself has revealed this to us.
Therefore, anyone who does not believe this Truth, will commit sin.
In the Christian religion there are some such doctrines which an ordinary person cannot understand by his intellect.
We are to believe the truths that God has revealed to us.
It is faith that gives us courage.
What is Pentecost ?
We all know that Jesus Christ rose from the dead on the third day.
After his Resurrection, Jesus Christ remained on this earth for forty more days.
After that he ascended into heaven.
Ten days after the Ascension, the Holy Spirit came down upon the Apostles in the form of fire.
Out of fear, Jesus disciples had locked themselves up in a room and were praying.
Since they received the Holy Spirit on the fiftieth day after the Resurrection of Jesus Christ, the day is called `Pentecost.
The Jews observe this day in commemoration of the giving of the Ten Commandments to Moses by God on Mount Sinai.
People from different nations around the world gather in Jerusalem to observe this feast.
Before his Ascension, Jesus had promised to his Apostles :
That God the Father would send the Holy Spirit to them to remain with them always as their Advocate.
The Apostles were waiting and praying in a room in Jerusalem for the coming of the Holy Spirit:
Suddenly there was a noise from the sky which sounded like a strong wind blowing.
Do you know what happened then?
They saw what looked like tongues of fire which spread out and touched each person there.
Everyone marvelled at this.
All those present in.
the room were filled with the Holy Spirit and began to talk in other languages, as the Spirit enabled them to speak.
Many Jews had gathered in Jerusalem to celebrate the Feast of Pentecost.
They had come from different countries and they spoke different language.
When they heard the noise, a large crowd gathered.
The Apostles then came out of the room and boldly began to speak about Jesus.
And a wonderful thing happened.
They were all excited, because each one of them heard the believers speaking in his own language.
In amazement and wonder they exclaimed, These people who are talking like this are Galileans!
How is it, then, that all of us hear them speaking in our own native languages about the great things God has done!
Amazed and confused, they kept asking, What does this mean?
But others made fun of the believers; saying These people are drunk !
But Peter stood up and proclaimed loudly saying, These people are not drunk, as you suppose.
We do not take any drinks and we are not drunk.
How great is the power of the Holy Spirit.
When Judas betrayed Jesus into the hands of his enemies, all the others fled in fear.
Saint Peter was the eldest among the Apostles.
Even he denied Jesus -three times.
But after his Resurrection, Jesus appeared to them many times.
Even then they could not get rid of their fear.
But on the day of Pentecost, when they received the Holy Spirit, they began to talk about Jesus boldly in front of his enemies.
They had no more fear, they were not even afraid to die.
Enlightened by the power of the Holy Spirit they understood the meaning of the teachings of Jesus.
From that time on they began to interpret Jesus message correctly for the people.
Having received the Holy Spirit, they were no longer concerned about their own safety; their only concern was to do good to the people.
Like Jesus, they began to work many miracles of curing the blind and healing the crippled.
So you see that the power of the Holy Spirit is just as infinite as that of the Father and the son.
He too is Almighty God.
Love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, generosity, gentleness, faithfulness, modesty, self-control, chastity.
Wisdom, Understanding, Counsel, Fortitude, Knowledge, Piety and Fear of the Lord.
We should be able to live in great peace and happiness.
In the previous lesson we heard that the Apostles were staying in a closed room in Jerusalem.
They devoted themselves to prayer while waiting to receive the Holy Spirit.
Once they received the Holy Spirit, they became very courageous.
In the power of the Spirit they began to speak in different languages.
When Jesus was put to death unjustly, they thought they would also be killed, and so they were afraid.
But when they received the Holy Spirit; all fear vanished.
They began to speak boldly against injustice and preached the message of Christ.
Let us now see in the Bible how he began his mission of preaching.
In accordance with the prophecy of Joel, Peter spoke thus to the crowd : Listen to these words, fellow Israelites !
Jesus of Nazareth was a man whose divine authority was clearly proven to you by all the miracles and wonders which God performed through him.
You yourselves know this, for it happened here among you.
But God raised him from death, setting him free from its power, because it was impossible that death should hold him prisoner.
Peter continued, My brothers, I must speak to you plainly about our famous ancestor King David.
He died and was buried, and his grave is here with us to this very day.
his body did not rot in the grave.
God has raised this very Jesus from death, and we are all witnesses to this fact.
He has been raised to the right-hand side of God, his Father, and has received from him the Holy Spirit, as he had promised.
What you now see and hear is his gift that he has poured out on us.
For it was not David who went up into heaven; rather he said this.
When the people heard Peter speak, they were deeply repentant for their sins.
They asked Peter what they should do.
For God's promise was made to you and your children, and to all who are far away-all whom the Lord our God calls to himself.
Peter made his appeal to them and with many other words he urged them, saying, Save yourselves from the punishment coming on this wicked people!
Many of them believed his message and were baptized.
About three thousand people believed in the Word of Christ and were baptized, and were added to the group of believers.
This is how the journey of the Church of Christ began on that day.
Under the inspiration of the Holy Spirit, the Church of Christ began to spread in may countries.
Those who, after hearing Peter's message, were baptized, went back to their own land and spread the Word of Christ to their people.
As a result the Church was established in various countries of the world, and it continues to spread even today.
For, Jesus had commanded his disciples before he was taken up into heaven: Go throughout the whole world and preach the gospel to all mankind.
Do not be afraid; I am with you till the end of the world.
When the Apostles received the Holy Spirit who had been promised by Christ, they became courageous.
Not only that, they became very responsible, for Gods power was working in them.
As a result they were prepared to defy even death and began to give witness to Christ.
They were not hesitant to present arguments to the people to prove what they were saying by citing words of prophet Joel and David.
Saint Peter invited them to turn away from their sins and to follow the path of Christ.
Inspired by Peter's message they came to understand that the person whom they had cruelly crucified to death, was Jesus Christ the Messiah.
In this faith they were baptized with the Holy Spirit.
Then they went back to their own lands and preached the message of Christ to their own people who became believers.
Was not this a wonderful thing?
The Word of God continues to be preached today and it will be in the future.
Like Christ, it is also our responsibility to preach the message of justice, truth and salvation to all.
Do you feel the power and the inspiration of the Holy Spirit in you ?
Through prayer we can receive the gift of the Holy Spirit from our Lord Jesus.
What must we do when we receive the Holy Spirit ?
We must bear witness by doing our duties properly.
People who come into contact with us should understand from our behaviour, our words and actions that we are Christian.
We must all remember that it is our duty to preach the Word of Christ.
The Holy Spirit gives us strength and courage to speak against injustice.
He helps us lead a holy life.
He gives us wisdom and understanding.
He gives us the power to understand what is right and what is wrong, and to judge accordingly.
If we have deep faith in the Holy Spirit, he helps us do the impossible, as did the Apostles.
O Holy Spirit, fill the hearts of your faithful with your light.
Give us your light, so that all our life we may walk in the path of holiness and justice.
Save us from untruth and injustice.
Be with us and guide us.
This we pray in the name of our Lord and Saviour, Jesus Christ.
Why do you persecute me ?
Gradually the Church began to grow in Jerusalem.
The Apostles kept working many signs and wonders in the name of Jesus Christ.
When the Pharisees, Sadducees and the High Priest saw this, they began to conspire against the Apostles and persecuted them.
They began to put to death many believers.
As the Church of Christ kept growing, there began persecution.
And Saul was the main leader-among those who were persecuting.
Now let us hear about the story of persecution by this leader of Jerusalem.
He was determined to persecute the Christians and wipe them out completely.
Then a miracle happened.
He was miraculously converted.
After his conversion, his name became Paul.
The word `Paul means small.
Now let us hear the story of Saul the great persecutor.
Saul was born in Tarsus in Cilicia.
He was brought up in Jerusalem as a student of the then best scholar, Gainaliel.
Because of his superior intelligence he was made a member of the Sanhedrin.
He became a staunch enemy of the disciples of Christ.
With a written letter, along with some companions, he set out for Damascus on Syria on a horse.
Saul and his companions marched forward like great warriors.
As they came near Damascus; a bright light from the sky flashed suddenly round him.
He feel down from his horse and-heard a loud voice from the sky saying to him, Saul, Saul!
Why do you persecute me.
Saul asked, Who are you, Lord ?
The answer came, I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom you persecute.
Get up and go - into Damascus, and there you will be told everything that God has determined for you to do.
Saul and his companions, as well as the bystanders, heard the voice of Jesus.
They turned around, but could not see anyone.
Saul rose from the ground and - opened his eyes, but could not see a thing.
The bright heavenly light made him blind.
Saul was unable to see anything, so his companions took him by the hand and led him to Damascus.
For three days he was not able to see, and during that time he did not eat or drink anything.
Then the Lord directed Ananias, a Christian, to go and restore Saul's eye- sight.
By God's will and his blessings, Saul came to be known Paul.
Saul was converted and he became a disciple of Jesus.
He is one of the greatest preachers of Christianity.
It was a great miracle that God saved the Christians of Damascus from the persecution of Saul.
Not only was God displeased with Saul, he caused him to become blind, so that he could not march into Damascus.
By persecuting the Christians, Saul had committed great sins.
As a penance for his sins God made him blind.
And during the three days that he could not see anything, he did penance by not eating or drinking anything for three days.
Jesus said, `Hate the sins, but not the sinner.
Our God always gives the sinner opportunity to change his sinful ways.
Saul was also given this opportunity.
So Saul was converted.
After being baptized into Christ, he went to different places in the world to preach the word of God.
There is hardly anyone else who preached Christianity in distant places more faithfully and fearlessly than him.
Be loyal and faithful, and God will forgive your sin.
Obey the Lord and nothing will happen to you.
Saul fell to the ground when he heard the voice of he Lord.
This fear has saved him from evil.
We have a conscience to judge what is good or bad.
Our conscience is like a watchful guard who always warns us and calls us to follow directions.
It is our duty to follow our conscience.
Sin cannot touch us if we follow the dictates of our conscience.
If we happen to fall into sin, we must do penance and ask forgiveness from God.
For God wants nothing but good for man.
Out of infinite love God has created man.
He wants every man should be with him in heaven.
On this earth, for the good of people he wants to make use of persons who have courage, who are conscientious and wise.
God never wants that anyone is persecuted by us on this earth.
He wants all people, irrespective of race, religion or, caste, love one another and live harmony on this earth.
Only then there will be happiness, peace and prosperity on this earth.
We know about the vision Saul had.
Now we will learn about how Saul's conversion took place.
After he saw the Lord, Jesus in a vision, he became blind.
His companions took him by the hand and brought him to Damascus.
There was a disciple in Damascus, whose name was Ananias.
The Lord appeared to him and said to him, Ananias!
He humbly answered, Here I am, Lord.
Ananias got frightened when heard the name of Saul.
For he knew that this Saul was the greatest enemy of the Christians.
And he has come to Damascus with authority from the chief priests to arrest all who worship you.
And I myself will show him all that he must suffer for my sake.
He will bring my message to the nations, to kings and to the people of Israel.
I myself will make him understand how much he will have to suffer for my name's sake.
So Ananias went, entered the house where Saul was, and placed his hands on him.
He said, Brother Saul, the Lord has sent me-Jesus himself, who appeared to you on the road as you were coming here.
He sent me so that you might see again and be filled with the Holy Spirit.
He stood up and was baptized; and after he had eaten, his strength came back.
After being baptized.
Saul stayed with the disciples in Damascus for a few days.
He preached in Dionysus that Jesus Christ was the son of God.
All who heard him were amazed.
They all knew that this man had been persecuting the Christians.
They also knew that he had come here to arrest the Christians and take them to the chief priests.
After many days had gone by, the Jews in Damascus met together and made plans to kill Saul.
Day and night they kept watch over him.
But he came know ; their plan.
One night Saul's followers took him and let him down through, an opening in the wall, lowering him in a basket.
Saul went back to Jerusalem and tried to join the disciples.
But they would not believe that he was a disciple, and they were all afraid of him.
He explained to them how he had seen the Lord, how had been converted and baptized.
He told the Apostles how boldly he had preached to the Jews in Damascus in the name of Jesus.
Then he stayed with them and went all over Jerusalem, preaching boldly in the name of the Lord.
He also talked and disputed with the Greek speaking Jews, but they tried to kill him.
When the believers found out about this, they took Saul to Caesarea and sent him away to Tarsus in Cilicia.
He did not stop preching when he went to his native town.
Even he though in his early life he had persecuted the followers of Christ, after his conversion be became one of the greatest preachers.
At -first he preached in Antioch of Syria.
From there he went to the island of Cyprus.
From there he went to Asia Minor where he preached the Word of God and baptized many in the faith in Christ.
He also went to Macedonia in Greece to preach.
Later he went to Corinth.
He wrote many letters to the believers in different places explaining to them about the faith.
Many of such writings have been incorporated in the Bible.
Finally he was executed in Rome for preaching the message of Christ.
Paul did not hesitate to lay down his life for the sake of the true God and his Christ.
We can never tell whom God will choose to do his work.
In his early life Saul was an enemy of the Christians and he persecuted them.
But God chose him, a persecutor, to preach his word.
God can bring good out of evil.
He is Almighty; there is no limit to his power.
Think of cow-dung, how negligible a thing it is.
And yet, when it turns into fertilizer, the farmers use it to grow golden crops in their fields.
Our life depends on the produce of the hand.
If there would be no cow-dung, it would be impossible to get a good harvest from the field.
There would be lack of food, and so people would suffer from want of food and malnutrition.
Paul too had been an oppressor.
But he was converted after the vision which opened up his eyes.
God forgave him all his sins and through his preaching glorified his Son.
By preaching the Word of Christ, he attained great peace in his heart.
Every believer in Christ is an Apostle.
It is our duty to preach the message of Christ like Paul the Apostle.
But how can we preach the message of Christ ?
By seeking justice and truth, by speaking the truth, by bearing witness to the truth and by doing our duties well.
Your main duty as students is to study.
It is not right for you waste time by playing or watching T.V. or listening to the radio when are supposed to be studying.
Wherever we are, on the road, in school, in offices, or in courts, when it is time to pray, we should pray.
In this way we can bear witness to Christ.
Many times we too act like unbelievers, just as Paul had done.
Our minds and conscience are sometimes covered with fish scales.
But by our faith in the Word of Christ we should remove the scales from our eyes.
That means, we should remove injustice and oppression from our lives, and live like good Christians.
We have to witness to the ideals of Christ by being kind to, those who are poor, suffering and helpless.
We have to courageously oppose, injustices.
When I realize that, what I am doing is wrong, then I should give it up right a way.
I should not oppress either the strong or the weak.
We should always be respectful towards other religions.
